intro: Triraphis microdon, commonly known as the small-stalked grasshopper plant, is a flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets. It is native to temperate regions of the northern hemisphere and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its delicate appearance, it is often grown in gardens as an ornamental plant.
